docTitle.titlePart:
Search for Neutralinos and Sleptons in scenarios with
Gravitino LSP and Stau NLSP with the DELPHI
detector up to 202 GeV centre-of-mass energy
Preliminary

byline.docAuthor:
R. Alemany
1 , F.R. Cavallo
2 , C. Garc√≠a
3 , F.L. Navarria
2 , G. Wolf

front.div:
Abstract
Sleptons and neutralinos were searched for in the context of scenarios where the
lightest supersymmetric particle is the gravitino. It was assumed that the stau is the
next-to-lightest supersymmetric particle. Data collected with the DELPHI detector
at centre-of-mass energies of 192, 196, 200 and 202 GeV were analysed combining
the methods developed in previous searches at lower energies. No evidence for the
production of these supersymmetric particles was found. Hence, limits were derived
at 95% confidence level.
front.note: Paper submitted to the Moriond Conference 2000
